rev.comment: That the Armenians were deported and murdered is not debated by the opposing sides, what is debated is if the Government is involved in the murders.
the "Most Armenian and Western...." claim is a fact. Also, it doesn't refer to the number. The last part is more easy to read like this IMHO... Maybe "murder" is not really neutral.
The Centeral goverment is not established to have ordered it, if that were the case this would not been a dispute. Tell me what you think.
Number version is required for comparasion
How about this? "Most" is not right. There are sources not limited to claim a variety of numbers. its not Turkey spesific that it is 200,000 I believe. Spesific nations make it long and complicated.
/* The Camps */added ==other camps== again. A bit of what I think is more NPOV
OK. parts of the international community. "France+otheer countries" should be mentioned. the lead section is a summary of the article.
Noo reason to remove ==Resources== + these headlines might be more helpful to the reader?
NPOV will require the lack of usage of words like MOST. Tell me how does it look.
France is mention later in the article.
Repaced intro with previous version by Fadix... The previous version was nonsens. It's not even a (N)POV issue.
not just Turkey. That is a solid fact.
Maybe just "camps" would be more neutral?
I don't see why the article should be stuck with your edition, when it contains claims proper to you, let stick to an article with specialists POV rather than a persons POV.
The grammer is fine. You need to stop reverting and let the mediator decide
Your article is beyond biases, it contains your POV, while nothing in mine are my POV. And besides yours contain deletings which is sabotage.
If you ask for mediation you leave the articles version dispute for the mod to see. Revering wont give you a better case. let hims see this version first and then yours.
You have admitted ignoring the subject, why are you making up things, I asked mediation, post your concerns there and stop injecting your POV in the article.
Wikipedia policy is to present significant positions, not your positions, you admitted ignoring the subject, so stop making uo things, then.
What Turkey nor Armania nor Academics say is irelevant compared to wikipedia policy.
Your edits not only contains POV but as well innacuracies that are even not claimed by the official Turkish foreign ministry publications. You ignore the subject.
/* Ittihadist trials, Constantinople, 1919 */ Over 300 years that city has been Istanbul
Mentioned later on. France's recognition has no special value.
I dont care what your problem is I treated you in a civilised manner, I asked for you to folow wikipedia procedure. I asked you to listen... Obviulsy you are not.
You have justified nothing, I will officialy ask for mediation today.
/* See also */ See also can only contain wiki links.. those are external
/* Resources */ those are external links. There is a section for those, do not clutter the article with extra sections.
You cannot talk as if the majority of the nations accept the dispute as a fact.
My edits are explained in the talk page. If I forgot any expl. point to it in the talk page.
/* The Armenian Genocide */ The proper format is not story telling.
one not a link but dont know where else to put it, perhaps an amazon.com link would work?
it obviously is a list, definatly not a wiki list. Ill be doing multiple edits, this is how you write NPOV
/* Armenians in Anatolia */ There are more than 2 races living there. No need to refer them one by one not practicle
/* Headline text */ Its pov if you give ratios, I would need to see basis regarding that. ==Headline== not wiki standard either. No need to definge genocide thats a wikilink avalible. Cleaning...
There is no POV or propaganda.
Your justifications are irrelevant still POV and propoganda oriented. Folow the wiki way or else.
Reverting back, there was no POV neither propaganda, 160 pages of answer at the talk page, justifying every changes.
reverted to DJ Silverfish, lots of [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|POV]] and [[propoganda]]
